Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2008 01:34PM Caseysmom wrote: I looked up both Adenofibroma and Fibroadenoma:  Here is what I found: Adenofibroma: 1.  A benign neoplasm composed of glandular and fibrous tissues, with a relatively large proportion of the gland.  2. Dense, fibrous connective tissue with interspered  glandular space.  Fibroadenoma:1. Findings that can be seen on a mammogram. 2. They are benign breast tumors that are made glandular and fibrous breast tissue.  3. Is a smooth rubbery hard lump that moves with in the breast tissues.  I hope this helps!

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2008 07:14PM Caseysmom wrote:  Hazelfox: Did you have any drains after your mastectomy?  With me I had small lumps near where by drains were at.  I asked my docs about it and they said it was nothing to worry about since all my tumor markers and scans all came back negative.  I would suggest letting your doc know whats going on just to be on the safe side.  IT took about a year for the lumps to go down. Laura Laura

Posts.Content: May 21, 2008 07:29PM Caseysmom wrote: Vickie: Bring your sisters together for a girls day and explain to them that because there is a strong family history of b/c you have been thinking about have a prophylactic bilateral mastectomy.  You could be surprised that they too may have been thinking about this and did not want to upset or worry you. As for your boyfriend I had the same fear of telling mine that I had b/c.  To my surprise after telling him about it he became very active in my treatment. He even told my oncologist and surgeon that we would do what ever needs to be done because he never wants to lose me.   He even helped me make my surgical decision of either have one or both of breasts removed and he suggested that I have a bilateral mastectomy. I told him that my chest would be scared on both sides and he kept telling me did not care as long as he would not lose me to this ugly disease.  It has been 2 1/2 years since my surgery and tram flap and we are still going strong.  Hugs Laura
Posts.Title: TRAM flap surgery vickie1 tam1953

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2007 09:11AM Caseysmom wrote: Oz: As of right now my docs are: PCP & Med. Onc. run the show together they both make sure that my other doc's get copied on all test a clinic notes. Rad onc: every six months also makes sure that my PCP and Med Onc. get copies of his clinic notes Breast Surgeon: as needed Plastic/Reconstructive: once a year she has me enrolled in a study GYN: once a year Derm: newest member of my team of docs. The cardiologist's that I work with do a complete work up on me once a year due to all the chemo drugs. Laura
